revised_title: Inheritance of Longevity and Selective Death-Rate in Man
tldr: This study investigates the inheritance of longevity and the selective death-rate in humans, analyzing data from family records and exploring the impact of environmental factors on the duration of life. The authors find evidence of a substantial selective death-rate that may be four times greater than the non-selective death-rate, suggesting that natural selection plays a significant role in determining human lifespan.
